intro: Vavaea brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stalked vavaea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Vavaea brevipedunculata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
